timeline.message: Make Jib support a single platform specification

timeline.body:
Generally you should limit the scope of `try { } catch` for this type of exception-checking tests, because theoretically other code (e.g., `ImageConfiguration.build()`) may also throw `UnsupportedOperationException`. We are checking the exception message which is very specific, but in the worst case, it's possible that a test becomes useless to catch a bug if the test doesn't check the message or the message is very generic.

```java
      ImageConfiguration imageConfiguration =
          ImageConfiguration.builder(ImageReference.parse("base/image")).build();
      JibContainerBuilder containerBuilder = new JibContainerBuilder(imageConfiguration, spyBuildContextBuilder)
          .setPlatforms(
              ImmutableSet.of(
                  new Platform("testArchitecture", "testOS"),
                  new Platform("testArchitecture1", "testOS2")))
    Containerizer containerizer = ...
    try {
          containerBuilder.containerize(containerizer);
```

and I guess `new Platform("arch1", "os1"), new Platform("arch2", "os2")` could save a few lines (which isn't important at all but I think it's an easy way to save some of the expensive screen-estate).
